intro: Pelexia glazioviana var. paraguayensis, commonly known as the Paraguay pelexia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Paraguay and Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
